page.title: 07Land Use (Crops)
page.content: The{main crop}in every farm in the Kinross area is{barley.}Most of the barley is sold for malting;the rest is sold for seed and feeding.One disadvantage in growing a lot of barley is the excessive amount of straw which is left over.Many farmers are unable to sell the straw so they burn it,which clears the ground of weeds and diseases.Other{popular crops are potatoes,wheat,peas,hay and silage.The silage is usually stored in pits,but towers and baling are also used.Another popular crop is oil seed rape.Rape can be made in to several different products consisting of oils, and is also used as winter fodder for sheep.It is expensive to grow but fetches a very good price.In this area the soils are very fertile;in many farms this is built up through carrying large livestock numbers,
